newsitem.title: USA: Another $2.5 bln in junk supply to hit corp market.
newsitem.headline: Another $2.5 bln in junk supply to hit corp market.

text.p: The high-yield sector is slated to provide this week's bulk of corporate bond new-issue activity as close to $2.5 billion gets set to come to market, dealers said.
On Monday alone, about $1.2 billion of the new junk supply is expected to hit, they said.
Among the issues are Adelphia Communications Group's two-tranche 144a debt offering consisting of $150 million 10-year notes and $150 million 144a 12-year exchange preferred stock, players said.
Smith Barney is expected to underwrite the deal.

Also on today's calendar is West Coast Entertainment Corp's $110 million 144a seven-year debt offering via Credit Suisse First Boston, according to players. Price talk on the issue is between 10.625 and 10.875 percent, they said.
Quezon Power Ltd is expected to bring its $203 million 20-year senior secured note offering via Salomon Brothers, high-yield players said.

Another $200 million in 144a debt is expected to come to market from Citadel Broadcasting Co. The deal includes $100 million 10-year senior subordinated notes and a $100 million exchange pik preferred issue due 2009, according to the sources.
